messages: 868ff6bd9cc395ee10345e7d9d6aa330 (00:59): how do i redo something i just undid with 'u'
868ff6bd9cc395ee10345e7d9d6aa330 (01:04): omg i hated vi like hell, but i start to appreciate it
370ae63b3a030c09fd0372e51542709d (01:05): Is there an equivalent to the -p command line within (g)vim?  Along the lines of :next - but using tabs
370ae63b3a030c09fd0372e51542709d (01:28): unlink: I'd like to open multiple files, each in a separate tab
960411147b7ee00d9ebde918d443b950 (01:29): Is it possible to put something in my .vimrc file that will change the default size of the gVim window (but not when I run vim in the console)
370ae63b3a030c09fd0372e51542709d (01:29): "gvim -p foo*.ext" will open each file in its own tab.  I'd like to do the same from within vim
370ae63b3a030c09fd0372e51542709d (01:30): I can use ":next foo*.ext" to open the files, but it doesn't put them each in separate tabs
370ae63b3a030c09fd0372e51542709d (01:32): :tabn moves to the next tab, but doesn't open the file for me ... I'm looking for something like :tabe, but with support for opening several files at once
edfb3a72abbb7ecf6e8f40e7ba7a3bab (01:47): how do i find what line i'm on?
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (01:49): 'ru? that'd better be a typo for either 'ls or 'nu
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (01:50): yeah. 'ls is a much better idea
a68dc5ae3ddabf401dc64c2b47e775b2 (01:50): i barely have any lines on my screen
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (01:51): you clearly have no taste
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (01:51): i bet you used to be an emacs user!
a68dc5ae3ddabf401dc64c2b47e775b2 (01:51): no way, i indent with an opening brace on the same line !
4681825a35d64c337a29c0b47b3d8b2e (01:52): how can I subsitute only the word under the cursor
4681825a35d64c337a29c0b47b3d8b2e (01:53): I want to replace it via a regex
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (01:55): try it when you're on the first letter of a word
a68dc5ae3ddabf401dc64c2b47e775b2 (01:55): well you'd only type the b if you weren't at the first letter :p
a68dc5ae3ddabf401dc64c2b47e775b2 (01:55): so on average, it's less typing
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (01:56): and doesn't answer the question!
a68dc5ae3ddabf401dc64c2b47e775b2 (01:56): i don't want to answer the question he asked, i want to answer the question i stuffed in his mouth!
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (01:57): hrm. isn't there a key that repeats the previous insert? i thought it existed, but i can't find it in the docs...
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (01:57): and no, i don't mean .
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (01:59): yeah, i looked in there
a68dc5ae3ddabf401dc64c2b47e775b2 (01:59): then it probably doesn't exsit
